get.summary: Retrieves a list of contents based on the parameters.
get.description: Retrieves a list of contents based on the parameters. For authenticated user, search results are filtered by the authenticated user's access rights (see ForresterAuth header below). 1. Note that fullName, imageUrl and uniqueId in the "authors" section are returned only for Blogs and Webinars

parameters.name: tmtxt
parameters.description: The term on which to search

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The order that the search results will be presented in
parameters.default: relevance if there is a tmtxt parameter/s, date if tmtxt is empty

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of filter IDs, as selected from the list of available IDs. Category ID should be used in this parameter. It should be used in "categories"

parameters.name: infoCount
parameters.description: The number of objects that should have expanded information

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Comma separated values of category IDs

parameters.name: ForresterAuth
parameters.description: A custom header value that must be supplied from the authentication token as returned by the Login resource

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: optional Auth0 authentication header. When this header is present, ForresterAuth header will not be checked

searchResults.title: The Forrester Wave: Mobile Low-Code Platforms For Business Developers, Q3 2018
searchResults.subtitle: The 12 Providers That Matter Most And How They Stack Up
searchResults.abstract: In our 30-criteria evaluation of mobile low-code platforms for business developers, we identified the 12 most significant providers  AppSheet, Betty Blocks, Dropsource, DSI, Intelledox, Microsoft, MobileSmith, Pulpstream, Quick Base, Skuid, Snappii, and Zudy  and researched, analyzed, and scored them. This report shows how each provider measures up and helps application development and delivery (AD&D) professionals make the right choice.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of reports and figures from a user's Reading List
get.description: Retrieves a list of reports and figures from a user's Reading List.  Reports and figures returned by the resource are filtered down to only such content as is accessible to the user specified by the ForresterAuth header token.  It is important to note that on the Forrester website, it is possible for a user to add content to his or her library without having authorization to it, so there can be a difference between the reading list acquired through this service and what is seen online.

parameters.name: inflate
parameters.description: The inflation level

parameters.name: encodedImage
parameters.description: Specifies whether the resource should return encoded images

parameters.name: ForresterAuth
parameters.description: A custom header value that must be supplied from the authentication token as returned by the Login resource

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: optional Auth0 authentication header. When this header is present, ForresterAuth header will not be checked

post.description: Adds a piece of content to a user's Reading List

parameters.name: contentID
parameters.description: The unique ID for the piece of content that needs to be added to a user's Reading List

parameters.name: folderID
parameters.description: The ID of the folder that the piece of content should be placed in. The available folder IDs can be found by parsing the GET readinglist output. If no value is present, then the content will be placed within the Default folder

parameters.name: ForresterAuth
parameters.description: A custom header value that must be supplied from the authentication token as returned by the Login resource

parameters.name: Authorization

get.summary: Retrieves the count of new content available by content type
get.description: Retrieves the count of new content available by content type. For now, the playbooks count will always be zero. We reserve the right to enable playbook "newness" at a future time.

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: required  The Unix Time (in milliseconds) representing the last time this method was called. In other words, 'x' in the statement "tell me the count of new content for this user since 'x'"

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Determines whether the resource returns a full list of content counts. If 'false', the resource returns the overall count. If 'true', the resource returns the overall count, the reports count, the playbooks count, and the figures count

parameters.name: ForresterAuth
parameters.description: A custom header value that must be supplied from the authentication token as returned by the Login resource

403.description: The required 'epoch' field is either missing or invalid

get.summary: Retrieves a list of content IDs that have been updated since a given epoch time
get.description: Retrieves a list of content IDs that have been updated since a given epoch time

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: required  The Unix Time (in milliseconds) representing the last time this method was called. In other words, 'x' in the statement "tell me the count of new content for this user since 'x'"

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: List of strings (same as 3 char endeca id prefixes). RES, AST, BLO, WEB, etc. If null, returns all

parameters.name: ForresterAuth
parameters.description: A custom header value that must be supplied from the authentication token as returned by the Login resource

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An optional Auth0 authentication header. When this header is present, ForresterAuth header will not be checked

403.description: The required 'epoch' field is either missing or invalid
